alert.note: Alert for Harney; Malheur (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 2:08PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM PDT/615 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oregon, including the following counties, Harney and Malheur. * WHEN...Until 515 PM PDT /615 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 208 PM PDT /308 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Winnemucca Creek, Miller Ditch, Bully Creek, Clover Creek, Stinkingwater Creek, Warm Spring Creek, Otis Creek and Wolf Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Juntura, Drewsey, Westfall, Beulah, Drinkwater Pass, Beulah Reservoir, Cottonwood Creek Reservoir, Castle Rock, Warm Springs Reservoir, Bartlett Mountain, Jonesboro, Westfall Butte, Otis Mountain, Monument Peak, Stinkingwater Pass, Battle Mountain, Buchanan and Van. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
